body: I'm with @andymikulski on this one; if we don't want to ever accept a preference with whitespace (and I assert that we don't), there's no user benefit to telling them but not fixing it. If we're really worried about confusing the user by changing their input (which I don't think we are) then we can pop a small message saying "whitespace removed" or whatever to let them know.
